0.user_question: Mark buys a fleet of 12 cars for his company.  Each car sells for $20,000.  He pays 10% tax on the cars and then another $1575034 for registration on each of them.  How much does he pay for everything?

ost_step.1: Mark bought 12 cars at $20,000 each which totals up to 12 * 20,000 = $240,000.

direct_answer.text: Firstly calculate the cost before any additional fees or taxes :    Number_of_cars*Price_per_car=Total_cost   Thus we get:    12*$20,000=$240,000. Next add the amount spent on registering all cars , thus you obtain ($240,000+$157,5034)=$397,5034 . Additional fee applies as well so Total Cost=(total without extra)+(tax)*(NumberOfCars) plus RegistrationFee*(NumberOfCars). This yields:$((($240,000+($24,000))+(157,5034)))/(12)$;This calculates outto $(($264,000+$157,5034)/12)=$$343,0034/$12=$28,5836..
